content.description:
A nice corner crack  running from the top of Get There From Here up to the Change Room. From the ledge on top of GTFH, climb the obvious left facing layback crack in the groove to gain a flare, then go up past a huge chockstone. A traverse into a second crack follows finishing with moves right to a tree belay. Mostly hand sized with some fist. Good chickenheads and features for stemming.

Straight above the top of Get There From Here.
Gear to 4"

Climb sloping ledges past two bolts to the base of the crack. Get some good pro at the base of the crack then layback up to the tree (awkward move getting around the tree, get pro in at the block below the tree or risk a nasty fall if you blow it) then layback the nice flake. From top of flake (where it thins) traverse right and climb past 5 bolts on/just right of arete. Belay at chain right of the top of arete. A sweet Pitch! Variation: Climb low fifth crack right of start. (fixed rope at times) From belay ledge (at top of crack) move left onto arete and climb past bolts to belay. This skips the 5.10 traverse move lower down. Moves to 5.8

Located on the wall directly above the top of 'Tree Frog'. Approach by climbing 'Tree Frog' or by flexing the fixed rope in a corner left of 'Tree Frog'
Cams to 3.5 inches, draws for the bolts.

climbs.name: Blackberry Corner
climbs.fa: D. Brayshaw Oct. 2019. Blackberry removal by John Valecko.

content.description:
This is the (formerly blackberry-filled) dihedral to the right of the upper arete of Bigfoot. The lower part of the dihedral is a tight flare with no crack, but the left wall is well-featured slab and it's possible to lean against the vertical right wall of the dihedral for support as well making for pretty easy climbing. After climbing past three bolts, a fist crack on the left appears and the grade eases off to low-5th scampering to the top.

Starts from the ledge below April Fool; reached by climbing Get There from Here (fixed ropes). Or step across from Bigfoot once you've climbed the crux of that route.
3 bolts, plus a piece or two of gear in the 2" to to 3" range

Climb a left-trending ramp (often wet in spring) past some bolts to a ledge (optional belay). Step right off he ledge and climb a steep curving fingercrack to gain the upper slabby arete of Bigfoot. Continue to that route's anchor.

Starts about 10 feet left of Bigfoot.
several bolts and finger sized gear

Immediately right of Bigfoot, climb a wide crack past a tree and diamond-shaped block to gain a ledge. From this ledge one can move out to climb the upper 5.8 part of Bigfoot or continue more directly up the groove line of April Fool. 
  
 This scrambly climb is distinguished mostly by a variety of fixed ropes draped down it. Using the fixed ropes reduces the difficulty to 3rd class.

Immediately right of Bigfoot off the ledge above the top of Wildcat's second pitch and Treefrog.
Fixed rope or large cam

Climb a slab past overlaps to a left-leaning flake. Where it vanishes, make a cruxy move left to another left leaning crack which improves and jogs right at the top. 
  
 Currently somewhat mossy as it was never thoroughly cleaned before the FA and has regrown. More traffic would help.

Well to the left of the other Stained Walls routes, this climb is just right of the fixed rope used to access Falcon Crest base, and is best reached by walking left along ledges from the Tictac/Serpentine area.
9 or 10 bolts
A broad and mostly undeveloped tier of crags running west from the top of Tree Frog to the Falcon Crest
